cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 171, Number 154 (Friday, September 19, 2025)][House][Pages H4489-H4490]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. STEUBE:H.R. 5533.[[Page H4490]]Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

bill.title: Streamlining FEMA Procurement Procedures Act of 2025

item.title: Streamlining FEMA Procurement Procedures Act of 2025
Streamlining FEMA Procurement Procedures Act of 2025

To direct the President to ensure that local governments may use Construction Manager at Risk procurement methods in carrying out certain activities under the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
